measured_by: drift rate parameter (δ) of the diffusion model
justification: "The drift rate reflects the within‐trial average rate of evidence accumulation (δ …) and the observer’s sensitivity to a given stimulus."

measured_by: boundary separation parameter (α) of the diffusion model
justification: "The distance between the decision bounds reflects the criterion for responding… Wider decision bounds indicate increased response caution."

measured_by: starting point parameter (β) of the diffusion model
justification: "If the starting point of the decisional process (β) is closer to one decision bound than the other, this indicates response bias."

measured_by: non-decision time parameter (τ) of the diffusion model
justification: "The time taken for non-decision processes is combined into a single estimate of nondecision time, τ."
construct: non-decision processing time / sensory encoding & motor execution latency

measured_by: slope of the centro-parietal positivity (CPP) EEG component
justification: "Kelly and O’Connell (2013) reported that the centroparietal positivity (CPP) reflected evidence accumulation, with higher rates of build-up when the motion coherence was high."
